definition: to clear a wild area for cultivation/to put under the plow

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: They also cleared bushland, dug wells and worked as market gardeners.
sentences.chinese: 他們還開墾灌木叢，挖水井，並從事市場園丁的工作。

sentences.english: Southerners feared homesteaders would add their voices to the call to stop slavery.
sentences.chinese: 而南方人則擔心開墾者會要求廢除奴隸制度。

sentences.english: A substantial part of the Netherlands has been reclaimed from the sea.
sentences.chinese: 荷蘭主要的土地是填海開墾而來的。

sentences.english: Aborigines developed these paddy fields beside a river.
sentences.chinese: 山地居民在河邊臺地開墾出一畦畦的水田。

sentences.english: We plan to bring all these mountain slopes under cultivation.
sentences.chinese: 我們計劃把所有的山坡都開墾出來。

sentences.english: All of the land they cleared and the houses they built belonged to the community.
sentences.chinese: 他們開墾的土地和建造的房屋都歸公有。

sentences.english: You must have a very large area under cultivation?
sentences.chinese: 看來你們一定有很大的開墾農地了？

sentences.english: The area of their newly cultivated land has come to/reached five thousand hectares.
sentences.chinese: 他們新開墾的耕地面積達五千公頃。

sentences.english: No farmer ever plowed a field by running it over in his mind.
sentences.chinese: 沒有農夫只靠在頭腦裏想象犁地，就能開墾出地來。

sentences.english: I'd have to purchase new sprayers, new cultivators.
sentences.chinese: 我還要購買新的噴灑器，新的開墾機。

sentences.english: Apollos must come there for pioneer work.
sentences.chinese: 亞波羅必須在那裏先起開墾的工作。

sentences.english: More wasteland will be opened up in a planned way.
sentences.chinese: 將有計劃地開墾更多荒地。

sentences.english: The disturbance ecological effect of reclamation on soil and vegetation of grasslands is studied in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 研究草原開墾對草原土壤及植被的擾動作用。

sentences.english: The world had vast uncultivated land areas.
sentences.chinese: 世界上還有廣闊的未開墾的陸地。

sentences.english: There are vast expanses of virgin land in the remote regions.
sentences.chinese: 在邊遠地區有大片大片未開墾的土地。

sentences.english: Before Liberation, the study on Chinese military medicine is a virgin land.
sentences.chinese: 建國前，中國軍事醫學史還是一片未開墾的處女地。

definition: to open up/to set up/to establish
to abandon (cultivated fields)/no longer cultivated/to lie waste/wasted/to neglect (one's work or study)
